name: Casa Quezada
description: Casa Quezada is a supportive housing site with 52 units for formerly homeless individuals with special needs. Many residents are Spanish-speaking immigrants with limited access to other subsidized housing in San Francisco. In partnership with the Mission Neighborhood Resource Center, Casa Quezada offers on-site clinical and case management services, daily meals, and community-building activities for all residents. This building is part of San Francisco's Coordinated Access Entry Point program.

howToGetIt: How to Apply: Call or visit an Adult Access Point: https://hsh.sfgov.org/services/how-to-get-services/referrals-and-housing-assistance/adult-coordinated-entry-access-points/
keywords: i am over 24 years old without children.
i am experiencing homelessness and i need immediate help finding shelter.
i am experiencing homelessness (on the street, couchsurfing, or other) and i need long-term housing assistance.
i am an adult over 27 years old without children.
agency: Mission Action (formerly Dolores Street Community Services)
